The_Wilsons_(country_duo):
{{Short description|Canadian country music duo, 2006–2012}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Wilsons | image = | caption = | image_size = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[Richmond Hill, Ontario|Richmond Hill]], [[Ontario]], [[Canada]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2006–2012 | label = [[Open Road Recordings|Open Road]] | current_members = Dave Wilson
[[Kortney Wilson]] | past_members = }} '''The Wilsons''' are Canadian husband and wife Dave and [[Kortney Wilson]], who were [[country music]]ians and television personalities in [[Nashville, Tennessee]].[http://www.newsobserver.com/living/home-garden/article141260933.html "HGTV ‘Flip’ stars share tips at Raleigh’s Southern Ideal Home Show"]. ''News Observer'', By Brooke Cain March 31, 2017 They were TV presenters on the HGTV program ''[[Masters of Flip]]'', having given up their music careers. They operated a business that flips (buys, renovates and sells) houses, the basis for the television program.{{cite web |last=Dekel |first=John |title=How a Canadian couple discovered the American dream in Nashville|url=https://nationalpost.com/entertainment/television/how-a-canadian-couple-discovered-the-american-dream-in-nashville |work=[[Postmedia]] |accessdate=2018-08-01}}{{cite news |title=Renovating and decorating with HGTV's Kortney and Dave Wilson|url=https://live.washingtonpost.com/home-front-20170914.html |newspaper=[[Washington Post]] |accessdate=2018-08-01}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.hgtv.com/design/design-blog/shows/11-things-to-know-about-dave-and-kortney-wilson|title=11 Things to Know About Dave and Kortney Wilson|website=HGTV}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.ottawaathome.ca/|title=Ottawa At Home|website=Ottawa At Home}} The Wilsons announced they were separating after 18 years of marriage on December 19, 2019. ==History== Dave, from [[Ottawa, Ontario]], and Kortney, from [[Ayr, Ontario]], separately moved to Nashville and signed solo deals with [[Lyric Street Records]].{{cite web |last=Shaw |first=Ted |title=Meet the Wilsons: CMT reality stars |url=http://www.canada.com/entertainment/Meet+Wilsons+reality+stars/2015924/story.html |work=[[Canwest News Service]] |accessdate=2009-11-19}}[https://www.pressreader.com/canada/windsor-star/20090917/281925949053562 "Meet the Wilsons"]. ''The Windsor Star'', 17 September 2009. While neither artist released an album for Lyric Street, Kortney charted two singles on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles & Tracks]] chart in the [[United States]] as Kortney Kayle. Kortney also made several appearances on the soap opera ''[[One Life to Live]]''.[https://www.proquest.com/docview/1797463559 "Masters of Flip duo dishes on their dynamic teamwork"]. ''Toronto Star'' Delap, Leanne. Jun 17, 2016 Page: E.1 The pair met and started a family after they were both released from the label in 2003.[http://www.moneysense.ca/spend/real-estate/buying/masters-of-house-flipping-kortney-and-dave-wilson/ "Masters of house flipping: Kortney and Dave Wilson"]. ''MoneySense'', Romana King May 11th, 2015 They began performing together as The Wilsons in 2006. In 2009, they became the stars of ''Meet the Wilsons'', an eight-part, half-hour series directed and edited by [[Bill Filipiak]] airing on [[CMT (Canada)|CMT]] in Canada.{{cite web |title=It's Time to Meet The Wilsons |url=http://www.cmt.ca/News/NewsItem.aspx?news_id=8578 |work=[[CMT (Canada)]] |accessdate=2009-11-19}}[http://www.metronews.ca/entertainment/2015/05/07/canadian-musicians-try-flipping-houses-in-reality-show.html "Canadian musicians try flipping houses in reality show"]''Metro News'', Bill Brioux, May 07 2015 The show debuted in the [[United States]] in December on [[Country Music Television|CMT]] with a four-episode marathon. The duo's first single, "Stick Together", was released in August 2009. The Wilsons released their first album, ''The Wilsons'', for [[Open Road Recordings]] in June 2010. They later lost their recording deal and turned to renovating and [[flipping]] houses in Nashville, and this led to them starring in the reality television series ''Masters of Flip''."Canadian country musicians look to real estate". ''[[Telegraph-Journal]]'', May 8, 2015.[https://nationalpost.com/entertainment/television/how-a-canadian-couple-discovered-the-american-dream-in-nashville "How a Canadian couple discovered the American dream in Nashville"]. ''National Post'', Jon Dekel, May 26, 2015 The series runs on [[HGTV]] in North America but is also shown in numerous other countries.{{cite web |title=Masters of Flip stars headline Edmonton Fall Home Show|url=https://edmontonjournal.com/life/homes/wilsons-on-the-way-masters-of-flip-stars-headline-edmonton-fall-home-show|work=Edmonton Journal |accessdate=2018-08-01}} In 2020, their new series ''[[Making it Home with Kortney and Dave]]'' premiered on HGTV Canada, where Dave and Kortney Wilson help homeowners create strategic moves with their money using their flipping expertise.Greg David, [https://www.tv-eh.com/2020/01/20/preview-kortney-and-dave-pay-it-forward-in-making-it-home/ "Preview: Kortney and Dave pay it forward in Making it Home"]. ''TV, eh?'', January 20, 2020. The show lasted one season before being rebranded ''Making it Home with Kortney and Kenny'', with [[Kenny Brain]] replacing Dave Wilson as the contractor following the Wilsons' separation. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! style="width:10em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| ''The Wilsons'' | * Release date: June 15, 2010 * Label: [[Open Road Recordings]] |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" !
